revised_title: A Further Study of the Poison Tree and its Effects
tldr: The author, William Sherard, provides a detailed account of the poison tree and its effects on people. He describes the tree's appearance, its cold wood, and how it affects individuals differently. Sherard also discusses the tree's seeds, which he received from Mr. Catesby in Carolina, and compares it to other plants like the sumach and Toxicodendron. He mentions that the poison tree has never been known to kill anyone, only to cause harm to certain individuals.
